intro: Acer insigne, commonly known as the noble maple, is a deciduous tree native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking red to orange foliage in the fall, which makes it a popular ornamental plant. The tree has palmate leaves with five lobes, and its bark is smooth and reddish-brown when young. It typically grows to a height of 20 to 40 feet and prefers well-drained soils in full sun. Acer insigne is also valued for its ability to thrive in a variety of climates and its ecological benefits to local wildlife.
